name: Clock and Strings
statement: There is a clock labeled with the numbers $$$1$$$ through $$$12$$$ in clockwise order, as shown below. In this example, $$$(a,b,c,d)=(2,9,10,6)$$$, and the strings intersect. Alice and Bob have four distinct integers $$$a$$$, $$$b$$$, $$$c$$$, $$$d$$$ not more than $$$12$$$. Alice ties a red string connecting $$$a$$$ and $$$b$$$, and Bob ties a blue string connecting $$$c$$$ and $$$d$$$. Do the strings intersect? (The strings are straight line segments.)
inputFormat: The first line contains a single integer $$$t$$$ ($$$1 \leq t \leq 5940$$$) â€” the number of test cases. The only line of each test case contains four distinct integers $$$a$$$, $$$b$$$, $$$c$$$, $$$d$$$ ($$$1 \leq a, b, c, d \leq 12$$$).
outputFormat: For each test case, output " YES " (without quotes) if the strings intersect, and " NO " (without quotes) otherwise. You can output " YES " and " NO " in any case (for example, strings " yEs ", " yes ", and " Yes " will be recognized as a positive response).

sampleTests.output:
YES
NO
NO
YES
YES
NO
NO
NO
NO
NO
NO
YES
YES
YES
YES
